I’m doing well, thank you. How about yourself?
Pretty good! I was just reading about some old housewives' remedies for toenail fungus, things like soaking in vinegar or covering the nail in garlic.
Oh, interesting! I've always been fascinated by historical beauty practices. They used some pretty unusual ingredients, didn't they?
Definitely! And some of them sound downright dangerous. Can you imagine putting arsenic on your face for a blemish?
It's fascinating how much our understanding of health and beauty has changed over time.
Absolutely. What do you find most interesting about these old remedies?
I think it's a window into how people dealt with everyday problems without modern medicine. It speaks to their resourcefulness.
It really does. It makes you appreciate how far we've come, while also recognizing the ingenuity of those who came before us.
